texts.definition: Actions whose success or failure depends on some form of dexterity, in most cases, eye-hand coordination.
markups: <style="Definition">Actions whose success or failure depends on some form of dexterity, in most cases, eye-hand coordination.</style>

Games challenge players in performing different types of activities. Those that include challenges whose outcome depend on players motoric abilities have <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style>.

Dexterity-Based Actions are those actions whose effects are determined by how the player physically performs them. The effects of the actions do not have to be directly connected to what the player is manipulating for actions to be dexterous: billiards and computer games are examples of how games can be manipulated through indirect control.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sports</link></style> are the oldest examples of <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style>. While some, e.g. the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Long%20Jump">Long Jump</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Sprints">Sprints</link></style>, depend relatively little on other factors the physical skill of participants are as important in individual <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sports</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Javelin%20Throw">Javelin Throw</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pole%20Vault">Pole Vault</link></style>, and team-based ones such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ice%20Hockey">Ice Hockey</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Soccer">Soccer</link></style>. While all these examples require heavy bodily exertion, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Boules">Boules</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Darts">Darts</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Pool%20Games">Pool Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Eight-ball">Eight-ball</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Snooker">Snooker</link></style> show that <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> do not have to be physically tiring.

While many associate sports with physical challenges and games with mental challenges, this mapping is false for many reasons. Relevant for this pattern, many games than are not considered sports do require <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Jenga">Jenga</link></style> is one of the most well-known <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Games</link></style> requiring <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> unless one considers rolling <style="Link"><link="dice">Dice</link></style> a skill; <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ascending%20Empires">Ascending Empires</link></style> is a more modern example.

<style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> are as good as ubiquitous in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Computer%20Games">Computer Games</link></style>. In <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Racing%20Games">Racing Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Gran%20Turismo%20series">Gran Turismo</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Mario%20Kart%20series">Mario Kart series</link></style> this consists of maneuvering, while for <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Platform%20Games">Platform Games</link></style> (e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/LittleBigPlanet">LittleBigPlanet</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Super%20Mario%20series">Super Mario series</link></style>) and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-Person Shooters</link></style> (e.g. the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Doom%20series">Doom</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Uncharted%20series">Uncharted series</link></style>), aiming and shooting are added to the needed skills. The same applies to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Fighting%20Games">Fighting Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Mortal%20Kombat%20series">Mortal Kombat</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tekken%20series">Tekken series</link></style> although having a good rhythm can be necessary here as well. Music games such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Donkey%20Konga">Donkey Konga</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Rock%20Band%20series">Rock Band series</link></style> show how <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> can consist nearly only of being able to keep a rhythm and press the right buttons.

<style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> are present in both traditional games and computer games, but are mediated in computer games. They must be <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style>, and for the latter case response times from computer systems can affect <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> negatively; if feedback from computers take too much time to appear - typically above 100 milliseconds - they do not seem to be the immediate effects of player actions and is thereby difficult to recognize as <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style>. This can somewhat be mitigated with games that have few <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Surprises">Surprises</link></style> and either use <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Timing">Timing</link></style> for single actions together with <style="Link"><link="progress-indicators">Progress Indicators</link></style> or use <style="Link"><link="rhythm-based-actions">Rhythm-Based Actions</link></style> where the delays can be ignored for the internal rhythm that players can maintain.

Two specific gameplay activities that often rely on <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> and <style="Link"><link="mimetic-interfaces">Mimetic Interfaces</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="physical-enactment">Physical Enactment</link></style>.

Being a <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Game</link></style> is however not enough for <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> to exist in a game. The real-time feature needs to be combined with some action whose outcome depends on the fact that it has to be done while the rest of the game state continues to update; for this reason, <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> can modulate <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style> even if they need the pattern to exist. Examples of actions that can create <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> are <style="Link"><link="maneuvering">Maneuvering</link></style> (especially to avoid <style="Link"><link="obstacles">Obstacles</link></style>), <style="Link"><link="stealth">Stealth</link></style>, and various forms of <style="Link"><link="combat">Combat</link></style> such as those depending on <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> actions or <style="Link"><link="capture">Capture</link></style> goals. Note that neither <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> nor dangerous <style="Link"><link="traps">Traps</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="environmental-effects">Environmental Effects</link></style> need to be present; <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Archery">Archery</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Darts">Darts</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Eight-ball">Eight-ball</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Jenga">Jenga</link></style> all give evidence to this and in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Computer%20Games">Computer Games</link></style> simply positioning <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="cameras">Cameras</link></style> can be <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style>. The various <style="Link"><link="rhythm-based-actions">Rhythm-Based Actions</link></style> possible are also ways of creating <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> since they are a more specific forms of these.

The difficulty of <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> dependent on how players can perceive the gameplay space. This is most often possible for game designers to affect in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Computer%20Games">Computer Games</link></style> (but see <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Strutfotboll">Strutfotboll</link></style>) through the choices of views possible. While <style="Link"><link="first-person-views">First-Person Views</link></style> can give players <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Spatial%20Engrossment">Spatial Engrossment</link></style> this does not necessarily make <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> easier since one cannot easily perceive the extent of one's <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Avatar">Avatar</link></style>. In cases where this may matter, most often in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Racing%20Games">Racing Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/F-Zero%20series">F-Zero</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Wipeout%20series">Wipeout series</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person Views</link></style> can be easier. In contrast, <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> can be more difficult in <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person Views</link></style> unless aided by some type of <style="Link"><link="auto-aim">Auto-Aim</link></style> mechanism.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Surprises">Surprises</link></style> make ongoing <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> difficult, and do any <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Disruption%20of%20Focused%20Attention">Disruption of Focused Attention</link></style> events. As a side note, for non-mediated <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> in sports, e. g., <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Archery">Archery</link></style>, the high levels of <style="Link"><link="gameplay-mastery">Gameplay Mastery</link></style> can be described as being able to ignore <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Disruption%20of%20Focused%20Attention">Disruption of Focused Attention</link></style> events - including the ones generated by one's own thoughts.

<style="Link"><link="crosshairs">Crosshairs</link></style> can be used to make the <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Action</style> of <style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> easier. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Leaning">Leaning</link></style> is a specific type of actions supported mainly in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-Person Shooters</link></style> to help players with <style="Link"><link="stealth">Stealth</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="combat">Combat</link></style> based on <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style>.

The interfaces that allow <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> are often of essential concern for games with these types of actions. This can be seen not only in the specialized equipment for the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Donkey%20Konga">Donkey Konga</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Rock%20Band%20series">Rock Band series</link></style> (and peripheral such as steering wheels for <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Racing%20Games">Racing Games</link></style>) but also the heavy regulation regarding which equipment is allowed in sporting competitions such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Long%20Jump">Long Jump</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Javelin%20Throw">Javelin Throw</link></style>, and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pole%20Vault">Pole Vault</link></style>. For this reason, <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> is an <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Interface%20Patterns">Interface Pattern</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> are typically <style="Link"><link="extended-actions">Extended Actions</link></style> that allow players to enter both <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Sensory-Motoric%20Engrossment">Sensory-Motoric</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Spatial%20Engrossment">Spatial Engrossment</link></style>. Mastering <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style> often forms the core of <style="Link"><link="gameplay-mastery">Gameplay Mastery</link></style> based on <style="Link"><link="player-physical-prowess">Player Physical Prowess</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="real-time-games">Real-Time Games</link></style>, and provide easy access route for creating <style="Link"><link="player-character-skill-composites">Player/Character Skill Composites</link></style> in games. Since players often have a high degree of granularity to affect the outcome when they use their bodies to perform <style="CurrentLink">Dexterity-Based Actions</style>, this can lead to an <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style>. One example of this is the often debated case if rolling <style="Link"><link="dice">Dice</link></style> is a skill-based activity.

<style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="extended-actions">Extended Actions</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="gameplay-mastery">Gameplay Mastery</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="mimetic-interfaces">Mimetic Interfaces</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="physical-enactment">Physical Enactment</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-physical-prowess">Player Physical Prowess</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-character-skill-composites">Player/Character Skill Composites</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Sensory-Motoric%20Engrossment">Sensory-Motoric</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Spatial%20Engrossment">Spatial Engrossment</link></style>
